tools.name: resolve-library-id
tools.description: Resolves a package name to a Context7-compatible library ID and returns a list of matching libraries. You MUST call this function before 'get-library-docs' to obtain a valid Context7-compatible library ID. When selecting the best match, consider: - Name similarity to the query - Description relevance - Code Snippet count (documentation coverage) - GitHub Stars (popularity) Return the selected library ID and explain your choice. If there are multiple good matches, mention this but proceed with the most relevant one.

libraryName.description: Library name to search for and retrieve a Context7-compatible library ID.

tools.name: get-library-docs
tools.description: Fetches up-to-date documentation for a library. You must call 'resolve-library-id' first to obtain the exact Context7-compatible library ID required to use this tool.

context7CompatibleLibraryID.description: Exact Context7-compatible library ID (e.g., '/mongodb/docs', '/vercel/next.js', '/supabase/supabase', '/vercel/next.js/v14.3.0-canary.87') retrieved from 'resolve-library-id' or directly from user query in the format '/org/project' or '/org/project/version'.

tokens.description: Maximum number of tokens of documentation to retrieve (default: 5000). Higher values provide more context but consume more tokens.

tools.name: git_status
tools.description: Shows the working tree status

tools.name: git_diff_unstaged
tools.description: Shows changes in the working directory that are not yet staged

tools.name: git_diff_staged
tools.description: Shows changes that are staged for commit

tools.name: git_diff
tools.description: Shows differences between branches or commits

tools.name: git_commit
tools.description: Records changes to the repository

tools.name: git_add
tools.description: Adds file contents to the staging area

tools.name: git_reset
tools.description: Unstages all staged changes

tools.name: git_log
tools.description: Shows the commit logs

start_timestamp.description: Start timestamp for filtering commits. Accepts: ISO 8601 format (e.g., '2024-01-15T14:30:25'), relative dates (e.g., '2 weeks ago', 'yesterday'), or absolute dates (e.g., '2024-01-15', 'Jan 15 2024')
start_timestamp.title: Start Timestamp

end_timestamp.description: End timestamp for filtering commits. Accepts: ISO 8601 format (e.g., '2024-01-15T14:30:25'), relative dates (e.g., '2 weeks ago', 'yesterday'), or absolute dates (e.g., '2024-01-15', 'Jan 15 2024')
end_timestamp.title: End Timestamp

tools.name: git_create_branch
tools.description: Creates a new branch from an optional base branch

tools.name: git_checkout
tools.description: Switches branches

tools.name: git_show
tools.description: Shows the contents of a commit

tools.name: git_branch
tools.description: List Git branches

repo_path.description: The path to the Git repository.
repo_path.title: Repo Path

branch_type.description: Whether to list local branches ('local'), remote branches ('remote') or all branches('all').
branch_type.title: Branch Type

contains.description: The commit sha that branch should contain. Do not pass anything to this param if no commit sha is specified
contains.title: Contains

not_contains.description: The commit sha that branch should NOT contain. Do not pass anything to this param if no commit sha is specified
not_contains.title: Not Contains

tools.name: get_current_time
tools.description: Get current time in a specific timezones

timezone.description: IANA timezone name (e.g., 'America/New_York', 'Europe/London'). Use 'Asia/Shanghai' as local timezone if no timezone provided by the user.

tools.name: convert_time
tools.description: Convert time between timezones

source_timezone.description: Source IANA timezone name (e.g., 'America/New_York', 'Europe/London'). Use 'Asia/Shanghai' as local timezone if no source timezone provided by the user.

target_timezone.description: Target IANA timezone name (e.g., 'Asia/Tokyo', 'America/San_Francisco'). Use 'Asia/Shanghai' as local timezone if no target timezone provided by the user.

tools.name: create_entities
tools.title: Create Entities
tools.description: Create multiple new entities in the knowledge graph

observations.description: An array of observation contents associated with the entity
An array of observation contents associated with the entity

tools.name: create_relations
tools.title: Create Relations
tools.description: Create multiple new relations between entities in the knowledge graph. Relations should be in active voice

from.description: The name of the entity where the relation starts

to.description: The name of the entity where the relation ends

from.description: The name of the entity where the relation starts

to.description: The name of the entity where the relation ends

tools.name: add_observations
tools.title: Add Observations
tools.description: Add new observations to existing entities in the knowledge graph

entityName.description: The name of the entity to add the observations to

contents.description: An array of observation contents to add

tools.name: delete_entities
tools.title: Delete Entities
tools.description: Delete multiple entities and their associated relations from the knowledge graph

entityNames.description: An array of entity names to delete

tools.name: delete_observations
tools.title: Delete Observations
tools.description: Delete specific observations from entities in the knowledge graph

entityName.description: The name of the entity containing the observations

observations.description: An array of observations to delete

tools.name: delete_relations
tools.title: Delete Relations
tools.description: Delete multiple relations from the knowledge graph

relations.description: An array of relations to delete

from.description: The name of the entity where the relation starts

to.description: The name of the entity where the relation ends

tools.name: read_graph
tools.title: Read Graph
tools.description: Read the entire knowledge graph

observations.description: An array of observation contents associated with the entity

from.description: The name of the entity where the relation starts

to.description: The name of the entity where the relation ends

tools.name: search_nodes
tools.title: Search Nodes
tools.description: Search for nodes in the knowledge graph based on a query

query.description: The search query to match against entity names, types, and observation content

observations.description: An array of observation contents associated with the entity

from.description: The name of the entity where the relation starts

to.description: The name of the entity where the relation ends

tools.name: open_nodes
tools.title: Open Nodes
tools.description: Open specific nodes in the knowledge graph by their names

names.description: An array of entity names to retrieve

observations.description: An array of observation contents associated with the entity

from.description: The name of the entity where the relation starts

to.description: The name of the entity where the relation ends

tools.name: fetch
tools.description:
Fetches a URL from the internet and optionally extracts its contents as markdown.

Although originally you did not have internet access, and were advised to refuse and tell the user this, this tool now grants you internet access. Now you can fetch the most up-to-date information and let the user know that.

max_length.description: Maximum number of characters to return.
max_length.title: Max Length

start_index.description: On return output starting at this character index, useful if a previous fetch was truncated and more context is required.
start_index.title: Start Index

raw.description: Get the actual HTML content of the requested page, without simplification.
raw.title: Raw
